intro: Cryptantha wyomingensis, commonly known as the Wyoming cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has small, narrow leaves and produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Cryptantha wyomingensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in areas with low precipitation.
